ElementDescription: The NDAR Global Unique Identifier (GUID) for research subject
Subject ID how it's defined in lab/project
Date on which the interview/genetic test/sampling/imaging/biospecimen was completed. MM/DD/YYYY
Age in months at the time of the interview/test/sampling/imaging.
Notes: Age is rounded to chronological month. If the research participant is 15-days-old at time of interview, the appropriate value would be 0 months. If the participant is 16-days-old, the value would be 1 month.

ElementDescription: Sex of subject at birth
Notes: M = Male; F = Female; O=Other; NR = Not reported

ElementDescription: What was your strongest sensation of any kind? (write-in)
Intensity of strongest sensation
Notes: 0= No sensation; 2= Barely noticeable; 7= Weak; 19= Moderate; 38= Strong; 61= Very strong; 112= Strongest imaginable sensation of any kind

ElementDescription: Yale Craving Scale (YCS): Brightness of high beam headlights at night
Notes: 0= No sensation; 2= Barely noticeable; 7= Weak; 19= Moderate; 38= Strong; 61= Very strong; 112= Strongest imaginable sensation of any kind

ElementDescription: Yale Craving Scale (YCS): Brightness of a well lit room
Notes: 0= No sensation; 2= Barely noticeable; 7= Weak; 19= Moderate; 38= Strong; 61= Very strong; 112= Strongest imaginable sensation of any kind

ElementDescription: Yale Craving Scale (YCS): Sound of a fire engine, close up
Notes: 0= No sensation; 2= Barely noticeable; 7= Weak; 19= Moderate; 38= Strong; 61= Very strong; 112= Strongest imaginable sensation of any kind

ElementDescription: Yale Craving Scale (YCS): Sound of normal conversation
Notes: 0= No sensation; 2= Barely noticeable; 7= Weak; 19= Moderate; 38= Strong; 61= Very strong; 112= Strongest imaginable sensation of any kind

ElementDescription: Yale Craving Scale (YCS): Desire to eat after skipping breakfast and lunch
Notes: 0= No sensation; 2= Barely noticeable; 7= Weak; 19= Moderate; 38= Strong; 61= Very strong; 112= Strongest imaginable sensation of any kind

ElementDescription: Yale Craving Scale (YCS): Desire for cold water after a day in the hot sun
Notes: 0= No sensation; 2= Barely noticeable; 7= Weak; 19= Moderate; 38= Strong; 61= Very strong; 112= Strongest imaginable sensation of any kind

ElementDescription: Yale Craving Scale (YCS): Desire to eat after finishing dinner
Notes: 0= No sensation; 2= Barely noticeable; 7= Weak; 19= Moderate; 38= Strong; 61= Very strong; 112= Strongest imaginable sensation of any kind

ElementDescription: Yale Craving Scale (YCS): Desire to sleep while driving a long distance well past your bedtime
Notes: 0= No sensation; 2= Barely noticeable; 7= Weak; 19= Moderate; 38= Strong; 61= Very strong; 112= Strongest imaginable sensation of any kind

ElementDescription: Yale Craving Scale (YCS): Desire for snack foods while watching TV
Notes: 0= No sensation; 2= Barely noticeable; 7= Weak; 19= Moderate; 38= Strong; 61= Very strong; 112= Strongest imaginable sensation of any kind

ElementDescription: Yale Craving Scale (YCS): Desire for a sweet after dinner
Notes: 0= No sensation; 2= Barely noticeable; 7= Weak; 19= Moderate; 38= Strong; 61= Very strong; 112= Strongest imaginable sensation of any kind

ElementDescription: Yale Craving Scale (YCS): Desire for a cigarette after a meal
Notes: 0= No sensation; 2= Barely noticeable; 7= Weak; 19= Moderate; 38= Strong; 61= Very strong; 112= Strongest imaginable sensation of any kind

ElementDescription: Yale Craving Scale (YCS): Desire for a cigarette after you wake up in the morning
Notes: 0= No sensation; 2= Barely noticeable; 7= Weak; 19= Moderate; 38= Strong; 61= Very strong; 112= Strongest imaginable sensation of any kind

ElementDescription: Yale Craving Scale (YCS): Desire for an alcoholic drink before dinner
Notes: 0= No sensation; 2= Barely noticeable; 7= Weak; 19= Moderate; 38= Strong; 61= Very strong; 112= Strongest imaginable sensation of any kind

ElementDescription: Yale Craving Scale (YCS): Desire for an alcoholic drink after a hard day of work
Notes: 0= No sensation; 2= Barely noticeable; 7= Weak; 19= Moderate; 38= Strong; 61= Very strong; 112= Strongest imaginable sensation of any kind

ElementDescription: Yale Craving Scale (YCS): Desire for a drink right now
Notes: 0= No sensation; 2= Barely noticeable; 7= Weak; 19= Moderate; 38= Strong; 61= Very strong; 112= Strongest imaginable sensation of any kind

ElementDescription: Try to remember the strongest desire to drink that you experienced last week. What were you doing then? (write-in)
Yale Craving Scale (YCS): Strongest desire to drink last week
Notes: 0= No sensation; 2= Barely noticeable; 7= Weak; 19= Moderate; 38= Strong; 61= Very strong; 112= Strongest imaginable sensation of any kind

ElementDescription: Think back to a time last week when you made an effort to avoid drinking. What were you doing then? (write-in)
Yale Craving Scale (YCS): Desire to drink when you tried to refrain from drinking last week
Notes: 0= No sensation; 2= Barely noticeable; 7= Weak; 19= Moderate; 38= Strong; 61= Very strong; 112= Strongest imaginable sensation of any kind

ElementDescription: Did you drink alcohol in the past week?
Notes: 0= No; 1= Yes

ElementDescription: When did you drink alcohol last week? (write-in)
Please rate the intensity of your desire to drink after you had that first alcoholic drink
Notes: 0= No sensation; 2= Barely noticeable; 7= Weak; 19= Moderate; 38= Strong; 61= Very strong; 112= Strongest imaginable sensation of any kind

ElementDescription: Think back to a time last week when you were in a stressful situation. What was the situation? (write-in)
Yale Craving Scale (YCS): Desire to drink when I was feeling stressed
Notes: 0= No sensation; 2= Barely noticeable; 7= Weak; 19= Moderate; 38= Strong; 61= Very strong; 112= Strongest imaginable sensation of any kind
